newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordanian gets life for shooting Israeli girls.
newsitem.headline: Jordanian gets life for shooting Israeli girls.

text.p: A military court in Jordan sentenced a soldier to life imprisonment with hard labour on Saturday for killing seven Israeli schoolgirls in March.
The five-man panel of military judges said the soldier, Ahmed Daqamsa, was guilty of murder but said his crime was not premeditated.

"The council finds that the circumstances of premeditation do not exist because it is clear that the accused suffers from a personality disorder, with a quick temper which he could not control," tribunal head Brigadier Mamoun Khasawneh announced.
Military prosecutors had told the court during the two-month trial that Daqamsa plotted to kill Israelis for years and carefully planned his attack.
But defence lawyers said Daqamsa was a pious man with a mental disorder, who was provoked by the girls while he was praying.
